Particulars: Different kinds expenses/fess bourne by the fund
Where we get Information in Prospectus: In the summary section of the prospectus we will get this information
Heading: Summary
Sub- Heading: Fees and expenses of the trust
Answer: The estimated annual trust ordinary operating expenses include a Trustee's Fee of 0.05%, a DJIA License Fee of 0.04%, Marketing expenses of 0.06%, and other operating expenses of 0.01%, totaling 0.16% of the Trust's average net assets.

Particulars: Different kinds expenses/fess bourne by the fund
Where we get Information in Prospectus: In the summary section of the prospectus we will get this information
Heading: Summary
Sub- Heading: Fees and expenses of the trust
Answer: The fund does not have a performance fee.

Particulars: weather dividend earned from the fund's investments will be re-invested in the fund or will be distributed back to the investors
Heading: dividends and distributions
Answer: Dividends are ordinarily distributed at least annually in January, and the Trust may make additional distributions shortly after the end of the year.

Heading: Summary

Particulars: Subscription and redemption rules
Where we get Information in Prospectus: PURCHASES AND REDEMPTIONS OF CREATION UNITS
Heading: Purchase (Creation) and Redemption
Answer: Before trading on the Exchange in the secondary market, Units are created at NAV in Creation Units, and all orders for Creation Units must be placed with the Distributor as facilitated through the Trustee by an Authorized Participant who has executed an agreement with the Distributor and the Trustee.

Particulars: Certain investment restrictions / not authorized to invest
Where we get Information in Prospectus: Additional  information regarding  dividend and distributions
Heading: Additional  information regarding  dividend and distributions
Answer: The Trust is not authorized to invest in the securities of registered investment companies or any other registered or unregistered funds, lend its portfolio securities or other assets, issue senior securities or borrow money for the purpose of investing in securities, purchase securities on margin, sell securities short or invest in derivative instruments, including, without limitation, futures contracts, options or swaps.
